metadata.title: CVE-2019-11035 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
When processing certain files, PHP EXIF extension in versions 7.1.x below7.1.28, 7.2.x below 7.2.17 and 7.3.x below 7.3.4 can be caused to read pastallocated buffer in exif_iif_add_value function. This may lead toinformation disclosure or crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2019-11035` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

libapache2-mod-php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
libapache2-mod-php5filter - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
libphp5-embed - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php-pear - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5 - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-cgi - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-cli - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-common - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-curl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-enchant - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-fpm - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-gd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-gmp - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-intl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-ldap - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-mysql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-mysqlnd - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-odbc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-pgsql - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-pspell - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-readline - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-recode - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-snmp - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-sqlite - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-sybase - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-tidy - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-xmlrpc - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
php5-xsl - 5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: php5 package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.5.9+dfsg-1ubuntu4.29+esm1').
